Summary Heading: STAFF NICE, ROOMS NEED TO BE MORE CLEAN
Summary: rooms need to be more clean, bedding was not change from previous people at the location,   carpet was dirty and even that is not a smoking room it smell like it , staff was really nice, in and out it was good

This place is filthy dirty . The sink drained slowly, the T.V stand had profanity all over it , the carpet was disgusting and the tile was sticky in the bathroom.it is supposed to be a non smoking room but smells like smoke and the blanket had burn spots on it

This was a horrible hotel. We had booked it for 2 days and left after 1. The hotel was disgusting! There was dirt in the tub, it smelled like old smoke even though it’s a “No smoking” hotel! There were stains all over the carpet. The toilet paper holder was broken and the toilet paper was put on the back of the toilet seat.
Room tip: Do NOT book here, especially if you have kids.

Summary: I had a horrible experience. The rooms are NOT clean or sanitized. The bedding was damp. The towels and pillow cases, were nasty, crusty and stained. We had no idea what we were coming to. We reserved over the phone to enter a nightmare. My room flooded over night. I had to be at work at 6am and didn’t get any rest because of this. I was reserved for 4 nights and demanded a refund. Never ever will I be staying at Wyndham hotels.

The carpet was filthy.  When I got out of the shower the bottom of my feet were black.  No Direct TV in my room.  Just an antenna that was supposed to get 117 channels but only 4 of them were in English. No toilet paper holder.  Toilet paper was on the bathroom counter.

Hotel unsafe...crackheads doing drugs outside your door. Room smelled disgustingly stink.  Front desk had the nerve to tell me when I leave the room don’t leave the air condition on and when I’m on my way back to the hotel call then and they would go in and turn on the air condition for me.  If it’s that serious sell the hotel.  Definitely not up to Wyndham standards

I was too tired with my long drive. Staying in this hotel was not a 5 star. You get what you pay for. The front dest clerk had a hard time explaining things. Thank you! I felt well rested for the long drive back home.

For your safety and health don’t go to this hotel ,     No kidding  Old place , carpets nasty, everything is broken,  beds make rash on your body, guys walking at night time looking inside the room thru windows and selling drugs  Very unsafe

not going to stay again at this location because of roaches and poor customer service. It was very unpleasant stay. I called to the office and try to tell what was the problem but very rude male worker just dint give a concern.

Dirty and grungy, inside and out. Loud all hours of the night. Toilet didn't flush for the first two nights. Made an online reservation for $196.56, my credit card was charged $229.60. Staff said there was a $30 security deposit that would be refunded. I'm still waiting. The Staff had NO experience with a customer showing up with an online reservation, it took three people to check me in, they were clueless. The bed was excellent. Internet was excellent.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: I will probably never stay at this hotel again. I have actually stayed at other Travelodges for the same price and had a much better visit. There is a great deal of noise from the car dealerships and sketchy looking people in the parking lot. The rooms are in desperate need of updating. They make such a deal about keeping your deposit if anything is damaged or missing, but the blankets are covered in holes and my shower was broken.

Summary Heading: Non smoking room smelled like cigarettes!
Summary: Non smoking room smelled like cigarettes upon arrival. Good hotel for a quick budget trip but expect your luggage and their contents to reek like cigarettes when you leave. Did not enjoy the smell at all. Also people were outside in the parking lot all night being loud and did not feel like it was the best location.Being so close to Knott’s and the price is the only reason to stay.

Summary Heading: No refrigerator, no ice, no running water, and no cable!
Summary: When I checked in I was told there was no refrigerator even tho online it mentioned there was! No running water for 3 hours. And they had no ice! The outside looked dirty and run down. The inside didn’t feel any better. The television had 7-10 channels in which half were in Spanish. Again none of this was mentioned online bookings. It was an awful experience I had originally booked to nights, but only stayed for 1 night. It was disappointing.

It was a clean and cheap, but basic room, a couple beds, desk, dresser, table, and a couple chairs. The "breakfast" was tried the 1st day but we skipped it the rest of the time as it was dry toast, muffins, a few pieces of fruit, and 2 choices of cereal, plus some coffee and some type of fruit juice. It was in the very tiny office. It was somewhat quiet with the exception of kids running back and forth. We probably wouldn't stay here again but for the price it wasn't bad.

We had a reservation booked through Wyndham Rewards using my Wyndham credit card to reserve it.  As we arrive at the hotel around 12:15am, we were notified that the reservation was canceled.  A couple of hours earlier, while we were on the road to the hotel, I had received an e-mail cancellation notice but as I was traveling did not see it until I arrived at the hotel. The hotel clerk, like a deer in the headlights, did absolutely nothing to help us find another hotel.  I had to call Wyndham outside of the hotel with my own phone to get some help to find me a nearby hotel.  I never received an apology or any compensation from the owner despite lodging a complaint with Wyndham and Travelodge.  DON'T STAY HERE!

If you need to save a buck, stay here. If you like amenities, find another place. Classic budget motel: no cups or glasses in the room, let alone a coffee maker. I had to get an iron and ironing board from the front desk. Plan on leaving a security deposit when you rent the room.

Summary Heading: The worst place I’ve ever stayed in.
Summary: Absolutely horrible- do not go there!!   Filthy sheets, towels and room in general- extremely noisy and service non-existent.  Definitely demanding a full refund!!   How can the Wyndham group associate themselves with this level of accommodations???!!

This property is not a advertised. Bullet proof glass at the desk, prostitutes in the parking lot at night. Strange men hanging out in the doorways of their rooms. Filthy room and bathroom. Damaged walls, stained bedding. We checked out as soon as we were able to get another room at a different hotel

This hotel is nasty DON'T go there has Nothing that it says on website and has roaches and they have no pool no DON'T go there peed out covers hotel smell like pee the staff didn't know anything horribly

Overall, this hotel was good.  Nothing fancy and Not high end, but perfect for budget conscious travelers.  Room was clean, continental breakfast was good and free (what looked like OJ was Orange tang, the kind we had as a kid), and staff was friendly.  Parking lot was also safe and secure.

Worker did not know much about the Wyndham Rewards points and room was dirty still had stuff from previous guests. Shower was dirty. Room had cockroaches. Smell of the room was horrible. Bed was pretty stiff and not comfortable at all.

Summary Heading: I won't take my family back
Summary: shady area..feels like I'm was going to get robbed...almost left in the middle of the night.   not sure why this Is apart of the Wyndham rewards.  Think I'll switch to another point system if I get into another hotel like this.   graffiti in shower, room very dirty, other peoples property left in closet.
Room smelled like smoke when rooms were non smoking rooms. Pictures online were not how the room looked! Very deceiving! Dead ants in closet and little stragglers in the bathroom!
The door did not have a secure lock. Bedding had not been washed, blood stains on the mattress, hairs in the bathtub. Dont bother with Breakfast unless you like stale cereal and boiled eggs.

Summary Heading: ants crawling in the beds... not clean at all... better bring a blue light
Summary: cheap tissue.. ants crawling in the beds.. pull your bed back if you choose to stay there and see what you find. old food, dust and dirt.. nasty.. if you ask me and I had my kids with me and the toilet got stopped. I had to ask for a nasty plunger that look like it was never cleaned from the last use
The towels had hair on them and our feet turn black from the carpet. TV was not mounted and toilet was damaged. Bathroom floor and floor boards were filthy.

I am a Wyndham Rewards member  and got this room through their site.  Not quite as nice as all the other stays at their properties.  Very worn room though fairly clean with too strong an order of cleaner. Being wheelchair bound I appreciated the roll in shower.  What I did not like, not Travelodgs's fault, was the car dealership across the street loud speaker was so loud I could here it in my room with music all the time with intermittent announcements

One of the worst places to stay ... VERY DIRTY items not working TV,  no light bulbs, smoke detector on the floor broken,  holes in the walls, WIFI not working Reported problems had to change rooms and found new room not much better  lots of Mold top to bottom in the shower area, long black hair all over the floor and nobody with black hair in my family  WOULD NOT RECOMMEND DO NOT STAY HERE

The cleanliness of the hotel was poor. Lots of blood stains, dirt stains, and stains we didn’t know of all over the sheets, walls, floors, and bathroom of the hotel. Very inconvenient. Also the service was poor. Checking in was okay, however, checking out there was a bunch of bad attitude given to me for no reason. We didn’t argue before or anything. So the staff needs to brighten up their mood the next time I stay at a travelodge again.

Summary Heading: The only thing great was the bed was comfortable
Summary: The location was awful you could hear everything from the dealerships across the street. The faucet in the shower got hot it almost burned my hand. The walls where thin you could hear everything. For the price i paid was way too much for the room.

Summary Heading: location was good, however, the room was very run down...
Summary: location was good, however, the room was very run down, there were ants all over the bathroom and the bathroom was very old and needed repair.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for.
Summary: Not sure if I would recommend this hotel or stay here again. We had an ant problem and toilet leaked every time you flushed it. I figured that we just slept and kept our belongings there being we were out all day I would just deal with the issue. We also had holes in our wall that hadn't been patched up. Rooms are overcrowded with big furniture, at least mine was. Wasn't asked if I was a Wyndham Reward member upon check-in and I forgot to mention it being I just drove over 8 hours.

Summary Heading: This place needs to be condemned.
Summary: I made a mistake booking this place. My error that I checked the box above the place I wanted to stay instead of below. I was districted by the low rate. When I showed up at the place I thought I was booked, I had no reservation. Check of my computer confirmed my reservation was for the Travel Lodge. I went to the hotel and checked in. As soon as I walked in I realized the place was trash. I was past the cancelation time so I had to stay. I called the front desk and canceled the next two nights.  I booked a King but for some reason about the king room had stuff stored in it so I was given a double. I could not get two keys because the manager told the clerk not to since people were taking keys. Numerous things were broken. The headboard on one of the beds was broken off the wall

Ants on bathroom counter. Interior has never been updated. Had only local channels plus about 5 cable channels is all. I’ll stick to Anaheim lodge when I’m feeling  cheaper but Embassy Suites by Disneyland otherwise.

This place was terrible.  I puuled in and could tell people were living there this is a bad sign. I seen girls that looked like prostitutes, I was right the pimp was beating the girl in the room next to for not working enough all night we could hear them. That morning we were going out for the day and before I got out of the parking lot the gangbangers were checking our doors, I seen them. We asked why they were checking our doors and they said they wanted to use the bathroom. Needless to say that didn't happen we got our belongings and checked out, we planned on staying 3 nights. We were able to find rooms in Anaheim in a nice hotel for less using another website for less and we had no more trouble. We were in the area to visit the attractions including Universal studios
Excellent..rooms were bigger than expected. Great service.  Parking was perfect and safe. Rooms were clean and spacious.
Really liked the location along with the free hot breakfast (waffle)   Cable channel selections could be better as the current selection was a bit weak  Overall,a great value

Summary Heading: I would never stay here again.
Summary: This hotel should not be in the Wyndham Rewards Program. There were roaches all over, the vent in the bathroom didn't work, the remote didn't work/TV could not be turned on any other way. They were going to bring us a new remote but never did. There's no way we were going to eat food that was provided by them when the room was so unclean. We were so exhausted that we chose to just go to sleep.  The pictures on line must be very old because it looked nothing like the room we stayed in.
There was a micorwave in the office only.  Breakfast upstairs - lousy choice for disabled.  Roll in shower; no hand-held device

Room was musty. Not very clean. Extremely old furniture.  Noisy throughout the night. Unsavory clintel. Someone asked my son if he wanted to by some "oxy"  .  Found hair on the wash cloth. Bath tub was dirty. No ice available. Told we would have to go buy some from the liquor store.  Breakfast was crap served in the hallway by the vending machines.
Manager Response: Sorry for your bad experience, thanks for pointing out the problem, we will fix as soon as possible.

Summary Heading: If you like to sleep with coackroaches and walking in to a...
Summary: If you like to sleep with coackroaches and walking in to a 200 degree oven every night then by all means this is the place... I killed more than 5 coackroaches in my two day stay and every time the maid cleaned they turned off the AC... why would you turn off the AC when it's over 100 degrees outside... this place is ridiculous!!!

Was my worst experience i got there between 10:30pm - 11pm i was so tired that i didnt even inspect room i should have:( will t just kept getting worst getting out of shower i seen that i had more guest in room with me roaches they where before i got there cause they where looking at me funny it had more i think to do with they new they where going to lose some cousin roaches that moment i had a chankla and some died tired and exhausted we all went to.bed cause when i woke tbere they where on a pillow asleep i called corparete and they said there hands where tied i cant even start on that wyndham teams said no$ to me getting other hotel. That i can check oy Out and go get for me or anything

Summary Heading: I got what I paid for
Summary: Hotel room was not as clean as it should have been. The shower had hair left over in it and we discovered a blood stain on one of the pillows that was on the bed, after my friend had slept through the night. There were a lot of empty rooms that we could see but management decided to put another guest in the room above us and we got to listen to them stomp around well past midnight. Like the title says, we got what we paid for. I should've paid the extra money to stay closer to where I was hanging out.

Summary Heading: Has potential but a ways to go
Summary: Under going remodeling.  Trying to upgrade, but not there yet.  Parking was limited.  Upon check in, clerk did not tell us about breakfast, internet, or anything... just gave us the keys.

They first gave me a room that was not cleaned yet.  The 2nd room they gave me the sink was broken and not draining.  The 3rd room had a broken air conditioning unit. When I went back and asked them for a new room they refused to give me one and said I had to deal with the severe heat until maintenance came around to fix it.  My small children were suffering from heat exhaustion and I'm in my 3rd trimester of pregnancy and I was getting sick and cramping. This was a health issue and they refused to accommodate. I called corporate and filed a complaint. I also told them if I have to go to the emergency room for this then I will sue!  The air conditioner eventually got fixed but my family and I had to suffer until it did. I also woke up to roaches and ants.  When I went to shower,

This place felt like we were in a hood. I thought since company is Wynham it be comfortable and a nice place. We walked in and right away we saw holes in the wall, light was hanging from ceiling, drywall wasn't finish, see bubbling on ceiling, mildew around shower, water temper adjusted during shower from hot and cold, you can gear a large rooming sound from upstairs everyone someone went to the bathroom or shower. Are keys didn't worm either when we came home from disneyland at 130 In the morning. It had to be reprogrammed. Also people must live there. They stay our drinking g anf getting high. Didn't feel safe. Even a guest next door pulled me over to ask if our room smelled bad because there's did.

We were running later that we expected and tried calling he motel to ask them to hold our reservation. Unfortunately we kept getting a message saying the phone had been disconnected. we tried calling the 800 reservations number and they just kept transferring us to the same disconnected number.  When we finally go tot the motel we saw that it was still there. We were not sure due to the fact we could not reach them. The night manager repeatedly denied there was anything wrong with their phones.   When we checked in he gave us a remote for the TV.. I guess they do not leave them in the rooms for fear of theft. Anyway the remote didn't work. Since the phone problem which didn't exist also knocked out the in room phones, we couldn't call the front desk to complain. We were too
Manager Response: Sorry for the inconvenience, the phone now is working.  Thanks for your review.

Summary: The hotel rooms had a terrible stench and the linens weren't very clean. The availability of breakfast wasn't the best and staff were very unwelcoming and unprofessional. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

Checked in on July 21st, 2 rooms, 3 adults, 3 teenagers  First room:  maintenance came to install a blow dryer after we checked in.  Left 6 holes in the wall, a mess on the sink, and no blower dryer  Second room:  told maintenance the bathroom door didn't stay shut or lock -- the inner workings were gone.    outside window high above sink/counter was open with a screen.   after teen climbed up on the counter, found that the glass part was broken and didn't shut anyway.   Bathroom walls had graffiti and the toilet didn't flush.   Told front desk and were told maintenance was gone for the day and would unclog in the morning.   At that point, we asked for another room and were denied.  We asked for a refund for both rooms as we were leaving and were denied.  Hotels.com tried and

Summary Heading: Well you get what you pay for lol
Summary: Runned down place, my family, parent, sisters family and aunts family all booked here. My aunts room had  roaches and they ended up going else where, my parents room was super runned down, light switches didn't work, holes in walls. My sisters room wasn't crazy bad and ours the bathroom was super old and no  fridge like stated. It was fine for the time but probably won't ever use this place again

First desk person could not check me in.  On a very hot day, the ice machine (which required $.50) did not work.  There was no ice bucket in my room. no soap, no tissue.  There was a condom wrapper next to the nightstand and ants in the bathroom.  Only the ceiling light of the three lights worked.  The cable selections were very limited and poor.  Very unappealing decor with too much furniture in a small room.  It is hard to think of anything positive to say about this motel.

I will never stay or book at a travelodge again! I booked a reservation, and when I arrived to check in I was refused service and told that I didn't have a reservation even though I showed my license and confirmation email! To make matters worse when I called the corporate office I was hung up on twice and no one would help me. I ended up taking the 6 hour drive home on no sleep. I am beyond upset and would never allow anyone I know to stay at any of there establishments in the future. If there were a zero star option I would be using that.

Summary Heading: This hotel was ok. The bed was comfortable but the bathroom...
Summary: This hotel was ok. The bed was comfortable but the bathroom had roaches.  It needed some updating.  There was a full size refrigerator in the room. The office people were hard to understand.
